website_summaries.verdict: Despite atrocious cosmetic qualities, the insanely cheap Superlux HD681 headphones have a sound that aspires to greatness and only narrowly misses the mark.
pros: The Superlux HD681 semi-open headphones approach hi-fi quality with a very detailed sound, and have a very even bass response
also, they are well-constructed, comfortable, and insanely cheap
cons: not very dynamic and can compress some music
can sound shrill with bright material
open design means they don't work well in loud environments

customer_reviews.title: These are amazingly accurate sounding headphones.
customer_reviews.text: A major recording studio in San Antonio, Tx had a blindfolded "headphone shootout." These headphones beat out every single pair they had there, including ones that cost over $200. The build quality is not great. They feel cheap because they are, but sound AMAZING and ACCURATE. I have worn them for many hours in a row, taking only short breaks, and they are also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: The almost perfect budget headphone, ruined by "treble assault".
customer_reviews.text: The Superlux 681 does almost everything right. Great imaging, good soundstage, good tight bass and sub bass with real impact, and nice smooth mids. But that treble... The treble is like broken glass, nails on a chalkboard and a sharp knife rolled into one. No amount of EQing or padrolling will tame it. So these headphones are a definite no-go for music. For gaming on the other hand.... They're great. Since games are not going to assault you with constant sound, the sharp treble doesn't offend, and the great imaging and soundstage really shine. Unfortunately these don't have a detachable cable, so things like the ModMic or V-Moda Boom Pro are out of the question. You need a separate mic.
customer_reviews.author: Mizkreant

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not audiophile grade. Tonal balance way too bright.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is nowhere near audiophile quality. I own Grado, Breyer, Sennheiser, Fischer, AT, and others. I read some of the amazing reviews and thought, why not check these out? And so I have. Garbage. Way too bright, no balance to the sound, no subtlety, none of that liquid smooth tone I’ve come to expect from headphones fed from my Glow tube amp. The bass is anemic... it is almost as if the drivers are out of phase. The hot high end makes them fatiguing after a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: gardenguy

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend these. Razor sharp high treble sounds that can pierce your ear drums and get you tinnitus especially if you are treble sensitive. The plastic quality is worse than a 5 dollar headphone. Very uncomfortable earpads with no support. You are much better off getting the Monoprice Retros. I love those. Better sound, quality and add yourself some Brainwavs XL's earpads and you are golden. Best bang on the market right now.
customer_reviews.author: Rarestform

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality decent for cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good for a $30 pair of headphones! I used them while mixing and mastering and they don't quite live up to my studio monitors but it helps me mix in a quieter environment. The headphones had decent treble and bass but seemed to lack mid-range. That being said, I went for a cheaper pair of headphones for the simple reason of transporting them back and forth between a friend's house so they get the job done for far cheaper than any major open back style headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming headphones on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give six stars for sound quality. I originally had the hd681 EVO but I am not a fan of the comfort and plastic build. I used akg240 and thought the audio quality was just as good I was so wrong. I use these headphones for gaming and bought the branwavez memory foam pads and the antlion modmic and I will never be happier with a build for this cheap. I will update of they don't last long but right now I couldn't be happier for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Michael Poplaski

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and awesome for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good "for the money" is comes up a lot when referring to these. These aren't gonna replace any audiophile headphones, nor should they. They are, in my opinion, the best headphones $30 can buy. They sound good, capture a wide range of sound without sounding exaggerated, and can be worn for hours without discomfort. The comfort really bears repeating! Also, they let in *just* enough of the outside world to let you hear yourself talk, which makes them great for use with a desk microphone (so you aren't shouting because you've got headphones on).
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Isacks

customer_reviews.title: Mixing? Need headphone? Check the specs
customer_reviews.text: I would (and will) buy these again. I use them for music production. The high ends are chrisp and the low ends rumble without distortion. However, i am a value driven consumer. I want the most for my money. If you are a name brand loving producer might not like these. If you like to get more than what you pay for and looking for headphones to mix your sounds; get these. They don't paint your sound.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Gee

customer_reviews.title: Whoa
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap. Like really bad. Sounds amazing. More articulate than my highly touted $140 studio closed back set which is kind of disappointing in a way. Up the quality and charge a few more bucks eh?
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: had to bend the wires
customer_reviews.text: These are good. I had to bend the wires that go over the top of the head; they were too tight for my head; now they are fine. They are big and padded and the cord is a little long for me, but they are good. Update after 14 months: one ear is now in and out in a subtle way., so they are done. They have had good usage every day for 14 months. I paid about $35 so not bad. Time to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: stevah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pair of all around cans!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these were way too flat and tinny for most media however that changed alot when I used the 7.1 Surround Sound settings on my PC and then they REALLY shine in EVERY department literally. For music,gaming,movies and videos they sound really well detailed and the bass is booming. They are also very comfortable to wear for long hours. I have a big head and I like playing games for 6 hours or more and these can basically sit on my head all day without hurting my ears.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is fantastic, but I was expecting that because of all ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fantastic, but I was expecting that because of all the reviews I read on these headphones. What I was not expecting however is how comfortable these things are. I can, and have, worn these for several hours straight with no discomfort of any kind. Would I recommend this product? Well, let's put it like this....I got these for my computer that I just built. This computer has a $400 cpu, $700 worth of graphics cards, a $500 custom water loop, etc etc...and these $35 headphones just might be the best purchase of them all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rout

customer_reviews.title: Very good phones for the money, and what a surprise as to how good they really are!
customer_reviews.text: I would never have believed it until I tried them. I have a set of very expensive and superb Beyerdynamics headphones (note that I do not normally listen through headphones), and while these phones do not equal the performance of the Beyerdynamics phones, they are excellent performers. I found a use for them in a secondary sound system, and I do enjoy them. They are certainly worth the little spent.
customer_reviews.author: John in SoCal

customer_reviews.title: These are some great headphones to get you hooked on HiFi
customer_reviews.text: These are some great headphones to get you hooked on HiFi. Not all drivers are the same, and these ones do have a pretty exhausting treble, but an EQ makes short work of that. I use mine for LPs and gaming and they work very well for that. I like the semi open back design and its great for lan parties when you need to hear the game and also your friends in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: Cole A.

customer_reviews.title: Outer foam piece fell off within a week...
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing sounding headphones! But, unfortunately the rubber foam piece came off within a week and it's very difficult to put back on. In the process of fixing the one, the other came off too. They do sound great - bass is nice and full (albeit a bit tinny on the high end). I would most likely not be able to recommend these due to the difficulty with the outer foam and how easily they come off and how difficult it is to get them back on again.
customer_reviews.author: George R.

customer_reviews.title: These are so good they should increase the price
customer_reviews.text: I genuinely believe these headphones should be more expensive then they are. You know headphones are absolutely amazing when you crank the volume to 100% and they are very very loud with no audio distortion. The bass is the best I've heard in any studio headphones. The audio quality is near perfect imo picking up even the slightest reverb. An amp is not required for these but if you want to push them to their highest potential its best to use an amp
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Boulderhead compliant
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't at all confident these would fit comfortably since I have a size 8 1/4 head. How delighted am I that they do fit and fit well! Great sounding phones for the money. I'm using them to monitor voice recording and they seem perfectly suited to the task.
customer_reviews.author: tim huffman

customer_reviews.title: No headphones in this price range will outperform these!
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones for the price, and more bang for your buck than the majority of headphones. The bass is slightly higher than the mids, and the treble is boosted. The semi-open design helps with the sound stage, which is decently large in my opinion, and great for music, but even better for gaming as it allows you to pinpoint noises and their origins. After a while though, the clamping force is a little too much and the ear pads are uncomfortable and can cause irritation, but with replacement pads these headphones are amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: nor will they be the best sounding headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: These likely aren't going to win any awards, nor will they be the best sounding headphones ever, but for how much they cost and with a little EQ adjustment, they sound phenomenal. I use them mostly for music and games, and so far no complaints whatsoever. I'd wager you get about 80-90% of the sound quality for a fraction of the price of major brands, though time will tell how they last.
customer_reviews.author: FalloutRip

customer_reviews.title: re: sound quality
customer_reviews.text: hella solid low freq bass capability. am impressed. got these for 4 ppl for xmas lol, made holiday shopping a lot easier getting half of it all in one order lol. everyone's stoked they love the sound these things put out. highly recommend, can't beat that kinda quality for this price, even hundred dollar ones don't match up sometimes. i'm glad i gambled my thirty bucks on a user review, dude was right lol! no complaints, very happy, didn't think good quality headphones existed at this price range anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little harsh, but smoothed out by Sonarworks
customer_reviews.text: These by themselves are a little harsh in the mid-high range. I use these for Recording Studio work and with the Sonarworks headphone calibration plugin, they smooth out nicely. The plug-in is a VST that is used with digital audio workstation (DAW) software. I bought these because Sonarworks has an average calibration curve for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, but built very cheaply.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones sounded great for the 50 days they actually worked. Maybe I got a bad pair, but I did not get my money worth of use out of these phones. I used these every day, and the left earpiece was dead within a month and a half of low-medium volume use. The cord tangled all over itself within a week without me even messing with it, and I could never get it straight again. I never took these phones anywhere, they sat on my desk plugged into my computer, but the cord still managed to fold and twist over itself.
customer_reviews.author: Alejo Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones - But this version is pretty uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Superlux HD681 EVO's (a white version) which had cloth ear covers on it. These have leather, and are not interchangable with my previous ones. Highly uncomfortable. Sound quality is just as good though
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pettigrew

customer_reviews.title: Saving My Marriage!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is learning to play piano. These are wonderful for us both :)
customer_reviews.author: Michele B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for the price. Just make sure to get a pair of more comfortable ear pads.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely phenomenal headphones for the price. The ear pads that come with the headphones are pretty uncomfortable so U bought a pair of cosmos 1 velvet pads meant for the akg k240's that fit rather snugly but make these things 100 times better. I have these things constantly on my head anytime I"m at my computer listening to music or gaming and I must say the value here is one you won't find anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle V.

customer_reviews.title: I can not comment on long term durability yet, ...
customer_reviews.text: I can not comment on long term durability yet, as I have not had them very long, but for the price I am VERY impressed with the audio quality. I can hear finger nails on bass guitar strings through a studio mix. +1
customer_reviews.author: Zebra Hoedown Throwdown

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright
customer_reviews.text: Hard to complain for the price. I bought these after reading a ton of positive reviews. They are super bright in my opinion. If you have some eq available, they're ok. I almost cant listen to them at all plugged straight into my phone. Very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: quite nice
customer_reviews.text: These are not super duper sound, but they are fun to listen to. I find them particularly good with acoustic music. Acoustic guitar sounds so natural through this, it's like you're in front of the player.
customer_reviews.author: ralph__86

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: These are some of best sounding headphones I have heard for the low price. Use them on my studio all the time. Thanks guys..
customer_reviews.author: Oscar M Coney

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, all treble no bass. mildly uncomfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.text: while sound quality is above-average, they feel cheap, there is no bass, no deep sounds, and little sound isolation. treble is very sharp, can induce a headache.
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Better than beats without the hipster allure
customer_reviews.text: my kid loves these. high quality audio without being trapped by brand name crappy quality. drop them, step on them, duct tape and keep listening. dubstep sounds just as jarring and annoying; but your kid will love the cushy foam and the dorky head strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Preader

customer_reviews.title: really good so far
customer_reviews.text: really good so far, one thing i do not like is that after long hours of use, my ears start to feel stuffy, mainly because these pads dont really promote air circulation. But then again its a headset, not an aerodynamic car
customer_reviews.author: The Real One

customer_reviews.title: For entry studio headphones are decent
customer_reviews.text: after 11 months i write this review so after this couples of months this headphone were being good but recently since last days of may the right side started to not work and today 8/10/2019 the right side no longer works but if your looking something quick and easy go and get them but if they are for long term you better get something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I'd hoped, but I still don't regret it
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I have a lot of love for Superlux but after a few weeks I've realized you do kind of get what you pay for. These headphones get really hot, and in the summer are kind of unbearable to use. The high frequencies are very tinny and there's a buzzing sound in the background. After just a few weeks, I've noticed that the right ear is louder than the left ear and sometimes you have to jiggle the aux input to make them work. I don't regret buying these headphones, but they're not a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Subway D.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Solid headphones for the price, they are a bit fragile-feeling but otherwise, they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: ☺

customer_reviews.title: Still works great and has only minimal damage after years of using ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for years, it was the first one I ever bought in fact. Still works great and has only minimal damage after years of using it. I love these headphones and still use them everyday for my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: They sound good for the price
customer_reviews.text: They sound good for the price; however they get uncomfortable when wearing them for an extended period of time (say, playing video games). Especially with glasses or earrings. One side stopped working after a little over a year.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great and they are pretty comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great and they are pretty comfortable. I would recommend getting some velour pads to replace the stock ones, but otherwise these are OK. 3 Stars due to only a few months of having them and the cable starting to go at the connection to the ear. Cable isn't surviving daily use and moderate moving around. I would recommend the 668B's over these.
customer_reviews.author: geirbiscohn

customer_reviews.title: The best value headphones, period.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is astonishing for the price, excellent range, and the chord is long enough for my cable management needs. Only bad thing is that it feels kind of cheap, but still is comfortable on my big dumbo ears.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it, and he says it is the best quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound quality and volume are great, not just for the price but for any ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for over a year now most everyday for hours and have never had comfort issues at all. I have a large head so this has been an issue in the past. sound quality and volume are great, not just for the price but for any over the ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Madden

customer_reviews.title: Good for Music, "alright" for games.
customer_reviews.text: 100x better than my G930s which had constant white noise. However I do miss the ability to adjust Treble and Bass like on my G930 and I miss the 7.1 surround sound. Great for a music enthusiast, decent for gamers. The treble is a bit much, but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: For the price they are good. The base is a little lacking and a ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price they are good. The base is a little lacking and a little muffled but is okay for everyday activity. The Ear muffs get hot after a wile and may lead to discomfort. They are vary durable and are made well so they should last a long time. Before you go and crank up the toons, be aware that they do not keep noise in well. Personally I would save up a bit more for better headphones but for this price there better than most I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good, cheap headphones. I remember reading a review that said they took a couple of uses to "warm up" and I found that to be true. They still work and I have had no issues. The cord is super long.
customer_reviews.author: Sypike

customer_reviews.title: Great set of head phones.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, They are comfortable to where for long gaming sessions, they allow me to actually be cognizant of my surroundings and not be terrified if someone comes down and tries to talk to me. Very great purchase for the price
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great but not immune to discomfort
customer_reviews.text: Holding up well about a year later but they do have a dull ache after very long wearing periods.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Carbon

customer_reviews.title: Great audio for cheap
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile but I like a good amount of base, and these headphones deliver on that front. For EDM and pop, these headphones are excellent. They don't feel premium, which is to be expected at this price, but the vinyl earpads get uncomfortable after about 2 hrs, so that is why I am taking off a star. The logo on the sides faded after a few weeks. Audio quality is really good for the price, though and I would still recommend them to someone trying to jam out on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound
customer_reviews.text: These sound terrible. They’re really bright and completely lacking in nuance. Will try to return.
customer_reviews.author: Garson R Olivieri

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are super comfortable and sound really great for the price. The semi open back means that you can’t get sound isolation but they are still headphones I wear daily.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: but not as comfortable as the cheap corsair gaming headset it replaced
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, but not as comfortable as the cheap corsair gaming headset it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Was going to buy a $150 pair of studio headphones when I decided to look here first. Paid about $26 for these - worth the gamble - and I'm glad I did! Build is solid, cord very long, and they are comfortable for longer sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but why such uneven frequency response.
customer_reviews.text: Seem sturdy, have good audio quality but the highs are peircing, had to purchase an EQ to use with these.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Sound is on point
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good, i wear glasses and these actually don't hurt like most that pinch my ear and frame arm after about an hour. I use these in combination with a mic for gaming and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John w mills iii

customer_reviews.title: An affordable treat for your ears!
customer_reviews.text: For what you're paying, you're getting a great sonic treat. The phones themselves could stand to feel better. I recommend adding on the headphone covers that work with the AKG cans similar to these, and you'll never want to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Watersun

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Good for about 2 years then just buy a new pair. For less than $40 id say 2 years was getting my moneys worth out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, not comfy.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is very good for price range, although they do feel a little cheaply made. Also long listening can cause pain on ears they’re a bit tight fitting and don’t adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the price these headphones are great. They have a pretty decent sound that is fairly balanced.
customer_reviews.author: meeks

customer_reviews.title: Nice phones with a good, flat response for tracking and mixing.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of volume, but only 4 stars because they get a little uncomfortable after prolonged wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Albie Beck

customer_reviews.title: Really sad that my dog chewed the cord and broke these
customer_reviews.text: Really sad that my dog chewed the cord and broke these. Used them as my monitors for my electronic drum set. Will be buying a new pair soon. :)
customer_reviews.author: ARossPhotography

customer_reviews.title: Hear Every Note
customer_reviews.text: Best sound quality ever heard through a set of headphones. Great value!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Grammo

customer_reviews.title: An Improvement over my Last Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Better than my last pair. They can make your glasses feel uncomfortable, but the cable length is a definite improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya Biznes

customer_reviews.title: Happy audiophile
customer_reviews.text: Really great for an audiophile without a lot to spend
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Holden

customer_reviews.title: Soundstage
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very good I have trh hd 668b and still not shre which sounds better both sound good. But the soundstage seems to be wider on these same with bass and vocals
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Those the job right. Thanks.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks.Sound and looks impressive, plus very light. Thats was I looking for, Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Aldeco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for the price... use them in my commercial studio. 4 stars because I've heard better phones at 20X the price — but for what these are 5 STARTS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dale L.

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is Great but feel tight on the face.
customer_reviews.text: These Headphones sound great! Great value. I recommend them all the time. The one downside is they are uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: kyle brainard

customer_reviews.title: Best for price and value
customer_reviews.text: No better headphone on the market for the price. If you are looking for studio monitoring quality without paying a fortune, these are what you are looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality but doesn't last.
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is fine, but the left speaker fell off after 3 months of desk use. I noticed it was loose a week before, but when using it a few days ago I noticed the left speaker had gone quiet and simply fell off when I took the headphones off.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight, very affordable. The best head phones money can buy if you have 40 monites.
customer_reviews.author: Aio

customer_reviews.title: Good bass, fits comfortably if a little bit big ...
customer_reviews.text: Good bass, fits comfortably if a little bit big and tight. Semi-Open means that it leaks the sound to the outside world and that it doesn't block outside noise. Despite this it delivers very good sound quality so only use this for indoors in a quiet neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Bass
customer_reviews.text: Zero noise isolation (as should be expected), very accurate sound for the most part; seems to entirely lack bass below 50Hz. Well-built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Styled like a set of AKG headphones
customer_reviews.text: Styled like a set of AKG headphones, they sound pretty good. Get the velour pads and they are pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones, great sound range of more than 100 dlls, fast shipping, I bought them again
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: This absolutely sounds like a semi-professional set of phones. At times i forget im wearing these, and not my Beyerdynamic 770s, which cost 6x more. Even the comfort level is adequate. This was a great purchase, and for the price of 30 bucks? It was a STEAL.
customer_reviews.author: David Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound on low budget, great after you do a few tweaks.
customer_reviews.text: Unbeatable sound for $28 Pads can be softer and more comfortable but hey it's 28 bucks and won't come with lambskin. Buy the akg 240 replacement pads for 7 bucks, easy fix still unbeatable price. Also download a soft EQ to lower anything over 6k by 2-2.5db, it will become even better.
customer_reviews.author: Li

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for video editing
customer_reviews.text: I have had expensive headphones and these are half the price and yet sounds just as good
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Braaten

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: they sound great and last a long time very comfortable as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality. Sure it's not your typical $200 pair but I live these things. The quality alone for this price was great and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Savickas

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but not as nice as the EVO's.
customer_reviews.text: I like the EVO's even more, but for the money these can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: audiomagnate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound quality and sound stage of this headphone, it is with for money, build quality is ok.
customer_reviews.author: faiz

customer_reviews.title: purchased at the end of september, 2016. here ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased at the end of september, 2016. here we are, beginning of december, 2016, and the right ear no longer works. get what you pay for, i suppose. will never buy a superlux product again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and sound space for the money buy these ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and sound space for the money buy these just do it they are stupid cheap and well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Zach O

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones for home use
customer_reviews.text: The effect that these semi open headphones have is just amazing
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The Surprising Superlux HD 681
customer_reviews.text: These headphones feel a bit cheap and plastic when you first handle them. They're actually built fairly well but that's the first impression you get when handling them. The sound insulation from outside noises is not great. If you need sound isolation another product would be a better choice for you. They are quite comfortable to wear for extended periods of time. The sound is very, very good for the price! I would say they outperform a number of other expensive products by the likes of Sennheiser, etc... I primary use these with an Objective2 (O2) amp I built.
customer_reviews.author: xephael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: really nice headset, for the price I couldn't find a more durable headphones
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: After going through a few headphones these have been the best bang for the buck! Best headphones under $100 I've tried so far.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher and Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in three years ago, and have had almost no problems. The cord is a little long, but that's a plus at times
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look for something else
customer_reviews.text: Three months and one side was dead. When operable, they had decent sound and sound quality. Unfortunately, that doesn't matter when connections go south.
customer_reviews.author: JRausta

customer_reviews.title: from now on the sound is horribly distorted and doesn't play any bass at all
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke after 31 days. Absolutely no reason why, from now on the sound is horribly distorted and doesn't play any bass at all. I've tried it in 3 different computers, all of them don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones at an affordable price. Surprisingly comfortable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Really nice headphones. I'm actually pretty surprised. I thought my sound card was bad. My speakers always made a hissing sound. Put these puppies on. Go figure, I just have sucky speakers. These are comfortable, inexpensive and the sound quality is amazing. I know there are probably better headphones out there, but I'd be hard pressed to find this quality at a lower price. ($29 at the time I bought it) They might be a tad big. The little plastic doodads stick up a bit. But it's like complaining that water is wet. For $29 the quality is there. I've had $30 headsets that were plain junk. (my skullcandy headphones literally fell apart).
customer_reviews.author: seniorgato

customer_reviews.title: They feel nice. audio quality is very nice
customer_reviews.text: These don't feel cheap at all. They feel nice. audio quality is very nice. The only issue I have with them is the jack, it is fairly large so it is not very mobile, however it does include a nice little adapter for a larger jack (I don;t know the name to it though).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck , period
customer_reviews.text: Simple , great sounding headphones , cant go wrong buying these
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones - good value
customer_reviews.text: I received these for christmas this year and they've been great. I've used them with my ipad, ipod, blackberry, pc, and my tv for playing xbox and watching tv with them. They have great crisp sound and fantastic bass as well. They're self adjusting which is a nice feature. Comes with a 3.5mm jack with a great screw-on 1/4" adapter as well. They are made out of plastic, but I'm only noting that in case you were expecting metal. I actually want to get a little headphone amp for these because I doubt my devices are driving them to their full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Quality is Crap.
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks, these headphones began to shock my ears when worn. The symptom was that no sound would come out of the headphones. I would jiggle the wire and sure enough, when I put the headphones back on it would shock my ear then start to work. Quality is Crap.
customer_reviews.author: The Diplomat

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working 1 month after I bought them. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Equal in value to headphones in the 75 to 100 dollar range
customer_reviews.text: A surprisingly great sounding HiFi Headphone for 30-ish dollars. Its sound quality is really jaw dropping for its price range. Its sound signature can compete with headphones in the 75 to 100 dollar price range. However, its clear that at 30 dollars they had to cut corner's somewhere and that place is materials. While being pretty sturdy its clearly made of fairly cheap materials. Also the sound while Bright can occasionally on certain recordings can easily veer into the harsh department. However these Can's respond well to EQ so just round that treble off a bit on the end and you get Astounding bang for buck.
customer_reviews.author: iamgeekusa

customer_reviews.title: Get the JVC HARX700 instead
customer_reviews.text: I got these for work so I could bring my JVC headphones home. The JVC HARX700 Precision Sound Full Size Headphones are WAY better. The Superlux ones are really tinny and had no low end. Definitely go with the JVC ones. Both are comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very very nice. Best headphones your gonna get for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rechy

customer_reviews.title: High quality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Thick cabling and metal frame. No cheap plastic anywhere. Won't break like my last two headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jtrier1

product_meta.title: Superlux HD 681 Dynamic Semi-Open Headphones
product_meta.description:
The HD-681 headphones from Superlux combine premium-quality audio components with an ergonomic design to offer accurate and detailed sound in a lightweight and comfortable package. Ideal for long, fatigue-free listening sessions, they are intended for use by musicians and audio professionals in monitoring applications, including recording live instruments and vocals, mixing, and more. The HD-681 features around-the-ear earcups which provide sound isolation from outside noise and help eliminate "headphone bleed" when recording in the studio. The semi-open design delivers a natural sound while still offering deep bass response and minimal sound leakage. Two 50mm neodymium drivers provide a rich, balanced sound with high resolution, wide dynamic range, and excellent stereo imaging. The headphones are equipped with a self-adjusting headband and thick around-ear cushions, providing the listener with a great fit. The HD-681 comes with a protective storage pouch and a gold-plated 1/4" adapter.

Condition Note: Item may have small scratches, may be missing some accessories and is in 100% working condition

Box Contains



 * Superlux HD-681 Professional Semi-Open Studio Headphones
 * 
 * Screw-On, Gold-Plated, 1/8" Stereo Mini Jack to 1/4" TRS Phone Adapter
 * Protective Storage Pouch
 * Limited 2-Year Warranty
